section.para: This window is displayed automatically when OmegaT loads a project, and can be called at any time using .
The window displays the following information:

listitem.para: In the window title: the total number of translatable files in the project.
These are the files present in the folder in a format that OmegaT is able to recognize.
As a list: all translatable files in the project.
Clicking on any file will open it in the pane for translation.
Each file entry lists its name, file filter type, encoding, and the number of segments it contains
The total number of segments, the number of unique segments in the whole project, and the number of unique segments already translated are shown at the bottom.

section.para: Typing any text opens a Filter field at the bottom of the window where parts of filenames can be entered. You can use arrows to select a file, and press Enter to open it for translation.

note.para: Filenames (the first column) can be sorted alphabetically by clicking the header. You can change the position of a file by selecting it and clicking one of the Move... buttons on the right.

section.para: Right-clicking a filename brings up a popup menu that lets you open the source file or the target file (if it exists).
The number of Unique segments is calculated by removing the number of repeated segments from the total number of segments.
The difference between "Number of segments" and "Number of unique segments" provides an approximate idea of the number of repetitions in the text. Use to obtain more information.

Modifying the segmentation rules may alter the number of segments/unique segments. This, however, should generally be avoided after you have started translating the project. See the appendix for details.
The buttons at the bottom of the window can be used to add files to your project:

listitem.para: Copies the selected files to the folder and reloads the project to take the new files into account.
Asks for the URL of the page and downloads it into the folder.

section.para: The two actions are equivalent to using the and menu items.

note.para: You can manually edit the configuration file to prevent the Source Files list window from opening automatically when a project is loaded.
